{"step_by_step_thinking": "The kidneys originate in the pelvis during embryological development and ascend to their final position in the retroperitoneal space. This ascension is halted by the inferior poles of the kidneys coming into contact with the inferior mesenteric artery. Therefore, the structure that would prevent normal ascension of the kidney during embryological development is the inferior mesenteric artery.", "answer_choice": "B. Inferior mesenteric artery"}
